_header: Our Father that art in heaven
_description: The Pater Noster, from an abstract of Myrk’s Instructions (1581) — six couplets

TCD211.First Lines:
Owre fader þat art in heuenþin name be halowed with meke
                    steuen…
TCD211.Last Lines:
…And lede vs in to no findyngBut schylde vs from all euel
                    þyng
TCD211.Note: Added at end by a hand of the fifteenth century.
TCD211.Editions:
Bitterling,  Klaus. 
             “An Abstract of John Mirk’s Instructions for Parish
                Priests.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 24 [222] (1977): 146.
